response.message: I love Winter Bash. Thanks to all! And bring on Winter Bash 2015.... (hopefully a little more global this time? :P)
I loved it. Shout out to the team who designed the winterbash site. I thought that had a good UI/UX.

I interpreted the Red Baron differently - to me, it meant "edit a good but poorly written question into a good question, and post a good answer".  Of course, both interpretations encourage good practice. 

Fun times, and thanks to the SE team and all the hat maniacs.
This was so much fun! I wish the Winter Bash lasted all winter--my virtual head is getting cold! :)
Is it weird that I recognize 18 out of the 27 avatars in this post?

Whoa! I made it on to the list for favorite avatars! Sweet!

Thanks for doing this guys, it's great fun every year.

Well, I guess a clean shave will have to do until Winter Bash 2015. 

Thanks for the good times!

I missed the Reversal debate on Meta.SO at first, but when I saw the requirements for Red Baron, my thought was "this is what the Reversal badge should have been".
Dangit, I was one of the two who missed the all-hats award by a single hat! Farewell, Winter Bash, it's been fun, and looking forward to next year. Thanks SE team for doing this!
It is my first winterbash and it was such a fun! Thanks :)

I loved winterbash.

Just a comment on waffles. I earned it, and apparently it is considered not to be a good thing (i.e., downvote, edit, and upvote later), if I understand the comments correctly above. However, I think it's a good practice when the PO's question is poor (e.g., unintelligible) to downvote it and accompany the downvote with a comment asking for clarification. When the PO back-comments and clarifies the question but doesn't adapt the question, I can edit the question and if I like it in its new form, I upvote. I think that's a good practice, not one to discourage
@Chris: Just to clarify, I don't think it's _bad_ behavior. Rather I think the downvote doesn't come naturally. Maybe a better idea would have been downvote _or comment_ followed by edit and upvote.

@Jon Ericson - downvoting can help to push folks to improve their question, at least that's how i use downvotes.

I loved winter bash and I have worn my Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas hat with proud and great pleasure :) THANKS
I was one of the people who got RED BARON!
I loved it very much

@Chris @Jon "downvoting can help to push folks to improve their question, at least that’s how I use downvotes." 

Here is an interesting look at downvotes: https://medium.com/the-physics-arxiv-blog/data-mining-reveals-how-the-down-vote-leads-to-a-vicious-circle-of-negative-feedback-aad9d49da238

@VonC: That's been making the rounds of the (virtual) office. It's a very intriguing study. We'd like to conduct the study with our data and see if we get similar results. For questions in particular, there are so many variables in our system it might not be easy to isolate the downvote effect.

My immediate response reading that article was to wonder if the "Warm Welcome" hat had an even smaller effect than I imagine.
